remarks: The value of a finite set of sequential integers.  E.g., ` 2 ... 5 ` means the set ` { 2 , 3 , 4 , 5 } ` .  A special case of this definition (starting at 1) appears as Definition 11-2.1 of [Gleason] p. 141, where ` NN ` _k means our ` 1 ... k ` ; he calls these sets _segments_ of the integers.  (Contributed by NM, 6-Sep-2005.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 3-Nov-2013.)
statement:
fzval $p |- ( ( M e. ZZ /\ N e. ZZ ) -> ( M ... N ) = { k e. ZZ | ( M <_ k /\ k <_ N ) } ) $.
$d M k $.
$d N k $.
